Question: What are the safe acupuncture points for first trimester?
Answer: SAFE first trimester points: ST36 (Zusanli) tonifies Qi safely. PC6 (Neiguan) for nausea - essential for morning sickness. KI9 (Zhubin) specifically calms fetus - the key pregnancy point. SP6 with very gentle technique. HT7 (Shenmen) for anxiety. Yintang for calming. GV20 (Baihui) to lift Qi. CV4 with very light touch or moxa nearby. Avoid all forbidden points strictly.
Points: ST36, PC6, KI9, SP6, HT7, Yintang, GV20, CV4
Pharmacopeia: Shou Tai Wan if threatened miscarriage
Safety_Warning: AVOID: LI4 SP6 combo GB21 BL60 BL67 sacral points - Use gentle technique only

Question: What points are FORBIDDEN in first trimester?
Answer: ABSOLUTELY AVOID in first trimester: LI4 (Hegu) - strongly moves Qi can cause contractions. GB21 (Jianjing) - descends Qi can induce labor. BL60 (Kunlun) and BL67 (Zhiyin) - promote labor. SP6 with strong stimulation - moves blood. All sacral points BL31-34 - too close to uterus. All lower abdominal points with deep needling. Any points causing strong De Qi sensation in lower body.
Pharmacopeia: None - Avoid herbs that move blood or descend Qi
Safety_Warning: CRITICAL: These points can cause miscarriage - Zero tolerance in first trimester

Question: How to treat severe morning sickness (hyperemesis) in first trimester?
Answer: For severe nausea and vomiting: PC6 (Neiguan) is the primary antiemetic point - use bilaterally. ST36 harmonizes Stomach. CV12 (Zhongwan) regulates middle jiao with gentle technique. KI21 (Youmen) for severe vomiting. SP4 (Gongsun) opens Chong Mai. Yintang calms. May need daily treatment initially. Acupressure bands on PC6 between treatments. Refer if unable to keep fluids down.
Points: PC6, ST36, CV12, KI21, SP4, Yintang
Pharmacopeia: Xiang Sha Liu Jun Zi Tang; Su Ye Huang Lian Tang for heat
Safety_Warning: SAFE treatment - Essential for quality of life - Refer if severe dehydration

Question: How to treat threatened miscarriage in first trimester?
Answer: EMERGENCY PROTOCOL: Immediate bed rest. GV20 (Baihui) with moxa to raise and hold Qi. KI9 (Zhubin) is the specific point for threatened miscarriage. CV4 with very gentle moxa nearby to warm and secure. ST36 strengthens Spleen holding function. DU20 lifts sinking Qi. AVOID all abdominal palpation and lower body points with stimulation. Refer for ultrasound immediately.
Points: GV20, KI9, CV4, ST36
Pharmacopeia: Shou Tai Wan (Fetus Longevity Pill); An Tai Wan
Safety_Warning: URGENT: Refer for ultrasound and medical evaluation - Bed rest essential - No blood movers

Question: How to treat first trimester fatigue?
Answer: Extreme fatigue is normal but can be supported. Points: ST36 (Zusanli) tonifies Qi - primary point. CV6 (Qihai) gently for Qi. SP6 gently nourishes blood. KI3 (Taixi) for Kidney support. GV20 lifts energy. BL20 (Pishu) for Spleen Qi if digestion also weak. Ensure adequate rest - fatigue is protective. Check iron levels. Light activity helps.
Points: ST36, CV6, SP6, KI3, GV20, BL20
Pharmacopeia: Ba Zhen Tang if Qi and blood deficient; Bu Zhong Yi Qi Tang
Safety_Warning: SAFE points - Encourage rest - Check for anemia

Question: How to treat first trimester anxiety?
Answer: Anxiety common especially with history of loss. Points: HT7 (Shenmen) calms Heart spirit. PC6 regulates emotions. Yintang for peace and calm. GV20 lifts and calms spirit. KI3 addresses Kidney-related fear. KI9 (Zhubin) calms fetus which calms mother. Ear Shenmen for ongoing support. Breathing exercises. Acknowledge concerns. Refer for counseling if severe.
Points: HT7, PC6, Yintang, GV20, KI3, KI9
Pharmacopeia: Gan Mai Da Zao Tang safe in pregnancy
Safety_Warning: SAFE treatment - Address concerns - Consider counseling referral if severe

Question: What are safe second trimester acupuncture protocols?
Answer: Second trimester is the safest period. Can treat more actively. SAFE points: ST36 SP6 (gentler than non-pregnant) for Qi and blood. KI3 KI9 for Kidney support. PC6 if nausea persists. All upper body points safe. Back points BL20 BL23 safe with side-lying position. LR3 gently for stress. Still avoid forbidden points though risk lower. Can treat musculoskeletal issues actively.
Points: ST36, SP6, KI3, KI9, PC6, BL20, BL23, LR3
Pharmacopeia: Pattern-based formulas with pregnancy-safe herbs
Safety_Warning: Safest trimester - Still avoid forbidden points - Side-lying position for back points

Question: How to treat second trimester back pain?
Answer: Back pain common as baby grows. SAFE points: BL40 (Weizhong) command point for back - very safe. BL23 (Shenshu) with side-lying and shallow needling. Yaoyan (extra point) for local pain. GB30 (Huantiao) with care for hip involvement. GB34 for sinew issues. Ahshi points on upper back safe. AVOID deep sacral needling. Side-lying or seated positions.
Points: BL40, BL23, Yaoyan, GB30, GB34
Pharmacopeia: Topical Du Huo Ji Sheng Tang liniment
Safety_Warning: SAFE: BL40 is the best point - Avoid deep sacral needling - Side-lying position

Question: How to treat second trimester leg cramps?
Answer: Leg cramps from calcium and magnesium needs. Points: GB34 (Yanglingquan) for sinews - primary point. LR3 nourishes Liver blood for sinews. SP6 gently for blood. BL57 (Chengshan) for calf cramps. ST36 for overall nourishment. Supplement calcium and magnesium. Hydration important. Stretching before bed. Shao Yao Gan Cao Tang is safe and very effective for cramping.
Points: GB34, LR3, SP6, BL57, ST36
Pharmacopeia: Shao Yao Gan Cao Tang - excellent for cramps
Safety_Warning: SAFE treatment - Supplement calcium/magnesium - Stretch before bed

Question: How to treat second trimester headaches?
Answer: Pregnancy headaches often tension or blood volume related. SAFE points: GB20 (Fengchi) with gentle technique for occipital headache. Taiyang for temporal. Yintang for frontal. GV20 for vertex. PC6 if nausea associated. LR3 gently if stress component. AVOID LI4 - use alternative points. Check blood pressure to rule out preeclampsia. Hydration and rest important.
Points: GB20, Taiyang, Yintang, GV20, PC6, LR3
Pharmacopeia: Avoid internal herbs - Acupressure and rest preferred
Safety_Warning: Check blood pressure - AVOID LI4 - Refer if severe or with visual changes

Question: How to treat second trimester insomnia?
Answer: Sleep disturbances common as belly grows. Points: HT7 (Shenmen) calms spirit for sleep. Anmian (extra point) specifically for sleep. KI3 for Kidney Yin. SP6 gently nourishes blood. PC6 for anxiety affecting sleep. Yintang for calming. GV20 for restless mind. Sleep positioning with pillows. Limit fluids before bed. Relaxation techniques.
Points: HT7, Anmian, KI3, SP6, PC6, Yintang, GV20
Pharmacopeia: Suan Zao Ren Tang gentle formulation
Safety_Warning: SAFE treatment - Sleep positioning important - Relaxation techniques helpful

Question: How to treat second trimester constipation?
Answer: Progesterone slows digestion. SAFE points: SJ6 (Zhigou) is the key point for constipation - very safe. ST25 (Tianshu) with gentle technique. ST36 for digestion. KI6 (Zhaohai) moistens intestines. SP15 (Daheng) locally with light touch. Increase fiber and water. Walking helps. Avoid straining. Avoid strong purgative herbs.
Points: SJ6, ST25, ST36, KI6, SP15
Pharmacopeia: Mild lubricating herbs only - Huo Ma Ren safe
Safety_Warning: SAFE points - Increase fiber and water - Avoid strong purgatives

Question: What are safe third trimester protocols?
Answer: Third trimester: Support comfort and prepare for labor (at term only). SAFE comfort points: ST36 SP6 gently for Qi and blood. BL40 for back pain. PC6 for heartburn. HT7 for anxiety. KI3 for Kidney support. AVOID labor-inducing points until 37+ weeks: LI4 GB21 BL60 BL67 SP6 strong stimulation sacral points. After 37 weeks can begin gentle preparation.
Points: ST36, SP6, BL40, PC6, HT7, KI3
Pharmacopeia: Comfort herbs only until term
Safety_Warning: Before 37 weeks: AVOID labor-inducing points - After 37 weeks: Can begin preparation

Question: How to treat third trimester heartburn?
Answer: Heartburn from pressure on stomach. Points: PC6 (Neiguan) for nausea and reflux - primary point. CV12 (Zhongwan) regulates Stomach with very gentle technique. ST36 harmonizes digestion. LR3 gently if Liver invading Stomach. CV17 for chest oppression. Small frequent meals. Elevate head when sleeping. Avoid lying down after eating.
Points: PC6, CV12, ST36, LR3, CV17
Pharmacopeia: Mild Stomach-harmonizing herbs only
Safety_Warning: SAFE treatment - Elevate head of bed - Small frequent meals

Question: How to treat third trimester swelling (edema)?
Answer: Edema from pressure on veins and fluid retention. SAFE points: SP9 (Yinlingquan) resolves dampness - primary. KI7 (Fuliu) regulates water. ST36 strengthens Spleen for fluid metabolism. SP6 gently promotes circulation. CV9 (Shuifen) for water metabolism. Elevate legs frequently. Check for preeclampsia signs - sudden severe swelling protein in urine high BP needs referral.
Points: SP9, KI7, ST36, SP6, CV9
Pharmacopeia: Avoid strong diuretics
Safety_Warning: Check for preeclampsia - Sudden severe swelling needs immediate referral - Elevate legs

Question: How to treat third trimester sciatica?
Answer: Sciatica from baby pressing on nerve. SAFE points: BL40 (Weizhong) is safe and effective - primary. GB30 (Huantiao) with shallow needling in side-lying. GB34 for sinews. BL62 (Shenmai) instead of BL60 which is forbidden. GB31 (Fengshi) for lateral leg. AVOID BL60 (Kunlun) as it can induce labor. Side-lying position for treatment.
Points: BL40, GB30, GB34, BL62, GB31
Pharmacopeia: Topical only
Safety_Warning: AVOID BL60 - Use BL62 instead - Side-lying position essential

Question: How to treat breech presentation with moxibustion?
Answer: BL67 (Zhiyin) moxibustion to turn breech baby. Start at 34-36 weeks for best results. Apply moxa to bilateral BL67 for 15-20 minutes daily or twice daily. Baby should move during or after treatment. Success rate 70-80% at optimal timing. Contraindicated if placenta previa low fluid levels previous C-section or other complications. Always under medical supervision.
Points: BL67
Pharmacopeia: None
Safety_Warning: Only 34-36 weeks optimal - Contraindicated with placenta previa - Medical supervision required

Question: How to prepare for labor naturally at term (37+ weeks)?
Answer: ONLY AT TERM (37+ weeks) can use labor-preparing points. Gentle preparation: SP6 with stronger technique from 37 weeks. GB41 to open Dai vessel. LR3 for smooth Qi flow. BL31-32 gently for pelvic opening. More active (40+ weeks): LI4 with SP6 is the classic combination. GB21 descends Qi. BL67 with moxa. Always with medical knowledge and approval.
Points: SP6, GB41, LR3, BL31, BL32, LI4, GB21, BL67
Pharmacopeia: Evening primrose oil orally and vaginally
Safety_Warning: ONLY AT 37+ WEEKS - Before this these points are FORBIDDEN - Medical supervision

Question: How to support natural labor induction at 40+ weeks?
Answer: Post-dates induction support (40+ weeks only with medical approval): LI4 and SP6 together - the primary induction combination. GB21 (Jianjing) strongly descends Qi. BL31-34 (Baliao) for cervical ripening and pelvic opening. BL67 with strong moxa. Nipple stimulation. Walking. Can treat daily. Monitor for signs of labor.
Points: LI4, SP6, GB21, BL31-34, BL67
Pharmacopeia: Raspberry leaf tea if approved
Safety_Warning: 40+ weeks ONLY - With medical supervision - Monitor for contractions

Question: How to treat labor pain naturally?
Answer: During labor - points for pain management: LI4 and SP6 for contractions. BL31-34 (Baliao) electroacupuncture for sacral pain. GB30 for hip pain. BL60 (Kunlun) now INDICATED for labor. GB21 for shoulder tension and to promote labor. PC6 for nausea. GV20 for calm. Ear points for ongoing relief. TENS unit on BL23 area.
Points: LI4, SP6, BL31-34, GB30, BL60, GB21, PC6, GV20
Pharmacopeia: None during labor
Safety_Warning: All points now INDICATED - Electroacupuncture effective for pain

Question: How to treat stalled labor?
Answer: For labor that has stalled: LI4 with SP6 strongly to restart contractions. GB21 descends Qi forcefully. BL31-34 with electroacupuncture. BL67 with moxa. Walking if possible. Position changes. CV4 area massage. Relaxation to allow Qi flow. Rest between contractions. Hydration. May need medical augmentation if prolonged.
Points: LI4, SP6, GB21, BL31-34, BL67
Pharmacopeia: None
Safety_Warning: Medical supervision essential - May need augmentation

Question: How to manage retained placenta?
Answer: For placenta that hasn't delivered within expected time: SP6 and LI4 strongly to move blood and promote expulsion. BL67 with moxa. CV3 and CV4 with massage. GB21 descends Qi. If significant bleeding - emergency medical intervention required. Acupuncture is adjunct not primary treatment. Medical supervision essential.
Points: SP6, LI4, BL67, CV3, CV4, GB21
Pharmacopeia: Sheng Hua Tang if approved
Safety_Warning: Medical supervision ESSENTIAL - Emergency if heavy bleeding - Acupuncture adjunct only

Question: What is the immediate postpartum recovery protocol?
Answer: First week postpartum - Recovery and restoration: ST36 (Zusanli) to restore Qi - essential. SP6 for blood recovery. CV4 and CV6 to restore lower jiao. BL20 (Pishu) for Spleen. BL23 (Shenshu) for Kidney. GV4 if Yang depleted from blood loss. Gentle moxa on lower abdomen to warm uterus. Rest rest rest.
Points: ST36, SP6, CV4, CV6, BL20, BL23, GV4
Pharmacopeia: Sheng Hua Tang first week for lochia; Ba Zhen Tang for Qi/blood
Safety_Warning: SAFE - Essential recovery period - Rest is critical

Question: How to promote milk production postpartum?
Answer: For insufficient lactation: SI1 (Shaoze) is the empirical point for promoting milk - primary point. CV17 (Shanzhong) regulates chest Qi. ST18 (Rugen) local breast point. ST36 and SP6 tonify Qi and blood for milk production. LI4 promotes flow. Frequent nursing/pumping essential. Hydration. Galactagogue foods: oats fenugreek brewer's yeast.
Points: SI1, CV17, ST18, ST36, SP6, LI4
Pharmacopeia: Tong Ru Dan (Promote Lactation Pill)
Safety_Warning: SAFE - Frequent nursing most important - Hydration essential

Question: How to treat mastitis postpartum?
Answer: Breast infection requires prompt treatment: SI1 (Shaoze) empirical point for breast issues. LI4 and LI11 (Quchi) to clear heat and infection. GB21 and GB41 for Shaoyang channel in breast. ST18 (Rugen) local point. SJ5 for lateral breast. Continue nursing or pumping on affected side. Warm compresses before feeding cold after. May need antibiotics if fever high.
Points: SI1, LI4, LI11, GB21, GB41, ST18, SJ5
Pharmacopeia: Pu Gong Ying (Dandelion) decoction
Safety_Warning: Continue nursing on affected side - Seek medical care if high fever - May need antibiotics

Question: How to treat postpartum depression with acupuncture?
Answer: Postpartum depression requires multidisciplinary support. Points: GV20 (Baihui) lifts spirit - primary point. HT7 (Shenmen) calms Heart. PC6 for emotional regulation. LR3 moves Liver Qi stagnation. ST36 tonifies overall Qi depleted from birth. Yintang for calming. SP6 for blood nourishment to Heart. Refer for counseling and possibly medication. Partner support essential.
Points: GV20, HT7, PC6, LR3, ST36, Yintang, SP6
Pharmacopeia: Xiao Yao San; Gan Mai Da Zao Tang for anxiety
Safety_Warning: Multidisciplinary care needed - Refer for counseling - Monitor for safety

Question: How to treat postpartum night sweats?
Answer: Night sweats from Yin deficiency after blood loss. Points: KI3 (Taixi) and KI6 (Zhaohai) nourish Kidney Yin. HT6 (Yinxi) is the Xi-cleft point to stop sweating. SP6 nourishes Yin and blood. LI4 regulates sweating. BL23 for Kidney. ST36 for overall recovery. Usually resolves as hormones stabilize. Check thyroid if persistent.
Points: KI3, KI6, HT6, SP6, LI4, BL23, ST36
Pharmacopeia: Liu Wei Di Huang Wan; Dang Gui Liu Huang Tang if severe
Safety_Warning: Usually resolves within weeks - Check thyroid if persistent

Question: How to treat postpartum hair loss?
Answer: Hair loss 3-6 months postpartum from blood deficiency and hormonal shift. Points: ST36 and SP6 to build blood. BL17 (Geshu) influential point for blood. BL20 for Spleen making blood. LR3 for Liver blood nourishing hair. KI3 for Kidney essence affecting hair. GV20 local point for scalp. Usually temporary - peaks at 3-4 months then regrows.
Points: ST36, SP6, BL17, BL20, LR3, KI3, GV20
Pharmacopeia: Si Wu Tang; He Shou Wu if severe
Safety_Warning: Usually temporary - Peaks 3-4 months then improves - Build blood

Question: How to treat postpartum back pain?
Answer: Back pain from pregnancy strain and breastfeeding posture. Points: BL40 (Weizhong) command point for back. BL23 (Shenshu) for Kidney weakness from birth. BL25 (Dachangshu) for lower back. GB30 for hip involvement. GB34 for sinew issues. Ahshi points. Core strengthening when cleared. Ergonomic nursing positions. Support pillows.
Points: BL40, BL23, BL25, GB30, GB34
Pharmacopeia: Du Huo Ji Sheng Tang
Safety_Warning: SAFE - Address nursing ergonomics - Core strengthening when cleared

Question: How to treat lochia that won't stop (prolonged postpartum bleeding)?
Answer: Prolonged lochia indicates Blood stasis or Qi deficiency not holding blood. If stasis: SP6 SP10 LR3 CV3 to move blood gently. BL32 for pelvic circulation. If Qi deficiency: GV20 with moxa to raise Qi. ST36 SP6 for Spleen holding blood. CV6 to tonify Qi. Refer if heavy bleeding clots fever or foul odor - may indicate infection or retained products.
Points: SP6, SP10, LR3, CV3, BL32, GV20, ST36, CV6
Pharmacopeia: Sheng Hua Tang for stasis; Bu Zhong Yi Qi Tang for Qi deficiency
Safety_Warning: Refer if heavy bleeding fever or foul odor - May indicate infection

Question: How to treat insufficient lochia (lochia not flowing)?
Answer: Retained lochia causes pain fever and infection risk. Blood stasis pattern. Points: SP6 and SP10 move blood. LR3 moves Liver Qi. CV3 and CV4 for uterus. BL32 for pelvic blood flow. ST29 (Guilai) for lower abdomen. Strong blood-moving appropriate postpartum unlike pregnancy. Refer if fever develops - may need medical evaluation.
Points: SP6, SP10, LR3, CV3, CV4, BL32, ST29
Pharmacopeia: Sheng Hua Tang - essential postpartum formula
Safety_Warning: Strong blood-moving now appropriate - Refer if fever develops

Question: How to treat postpartum constipation?
Answer: Constipation from hormones pain medications and weakened abdominal muscles. Points: SJ6 (Zhigou) primary point for constipation. ST25 (Tianshu) for Large Intestine. ST36 for digestion. KI6 moistens intestines. SP15 locally. Increase fiber and water. Walking when able. Stool softeners safe if breastfeeding. Address fear of pain from tears.
Points: SJ6, ST25, ST36, KI6, SP15
Pharmacopeia: Huo Ma Ren safe while breastfeeding
Safety_Warning: SAFE - Increase fiber/water - Walking helps - Address pain fears

Question: How to treat C-section recovery with acupuncture?
Answer: C-section recovery needs Blood stasis clearing and incision healing. Points: SP6 SP10 to move blood stasis from surgery. ST36 for Qi recovery. CV6 above incision for Qi. LI4 promotes healing and regulates bowels. ST25 for bloating. GB34 for mobility. Electroacupuncture around (not on) incision for pain and healing. Scar tissue treatment later.
Points: SP6, SP10, ST36, CV6, LI4, ST25, GB34
Pharmacopeia: Sheng Hua Tang; Add Qi tonics
Safety_Warning: Avoid needling directly on incision until healed - Electroacupuncture effective for pain

Question: How to treat pregnancy-related carpal tunnel postpartum?
Answer: Carpal tunnel often persists postpartum especially with breastfeeding. Points: PC7 (Daling) and PC6 for local effect. LI10 (Shousanli) instead of LI4 if breastfeeding concerns. SJ5 (Waiguan) for wrist. SI3 for ulnar symptoms. HT7 local point. Now LI4 can be used postpartum if not concerned about milk supply. Wrist splints at night. Ergonomic feeding positions.
Points: PC7, PC6, LI10, SJ5, SI3, HT7, LI4
Pharmacopeia: Topical treatment
Safety_Warning: SAFE - Wrist splints helpful - Ergonomic positioning

Question: How to treat diastasis recti postpartum?
Answer: Abdominal separation needs gentle core rehabilitation. Points: CV6 (Qihai) and CV4 to strengthen lower jiao. ST25 for abdominal muscles. SP15 lateral abdominal support. ST36 for overall Qi. Moxa on lower abdomen to tone. Refer to pelvic floor physiotherapist. Avoid crunches and planks initially. Diaphragmatic breathing. Gentle core exercises when cleared.
Points: CV6, CV4, ST25, SP15, ST36
Pharmacopeia: Bu Zhong Yi Qi Tang if Qi sinking
Safety_Warning: Refer to pelvic floor PT - Avoid crunches initially - Gentle progression

Question: How to treat pelvic floor weakness postpartum?
Answer: Pelvic floor weakness after vaginal birth. Points: CV4 (Guanyuan) strengthens lower jiao. CV3 for bladder. GV20 with moxa raises sinking Qi. ST36 tonifies Qi. SP6 for overall pelvic support. BL32 for sacral nerve. Kegel exercises essential. Refer to pelvic floor physiotherapist. May need pessary assessment if prolapse developing.
Points: CV4, CV3, GV20, ST36, SP6, BL32
Pharmacopeia: Bu Zhong Yi Qi Tang to lift Qi
Safety_Warning: Refer to pelvic floor PT - Kegels essential - Monitor for prolapse

Question: How to support breastfeeding difficulties?
Answer: Various breastfeeding issues: Low supply: SI1 ST36 SP6 CV17. Blocked ducts: LR3 GB41 GB21 local massage. Painful latch: Check positioning refer to lactation consultant. Engorgement: GB21 SI1 cold compresses. Nipple pain: Topical treatment check latch. Frequent nursing is primary treatment. Hydration nutrition rest essential.
Points: SI1, ST36, SP6, CV17, LR3, GB41, GB21
Pharmacopeia: Pattern-based
Safety_Warning: Refer to lactation consultant - Frequent nursing most important

Question: How to treat postpartum anxiety?
Answer: Anxiety common especially with first baby or difficult birth. Points: HT7 (Shenmen) calms Heart - primary. PC6 for emotional regulation. Yintang for peace. GV20 calms spirit. LR3 for Liver Qi stagnation causing irritability. KI3 addresses fear. SP6 nourishes blood to Heart. Breathing exercises. Sleep when baby sleeps. Support system essential. Refer if severe.
Points: HT7, PC6, Yintang, GV20, LR3, KI3, SP6
Pharmacopeia: Gan Mai Da Zao Tang; Xiao Yao San
Safety_Warning: Support system essential - Refer if severe or intrusive thoughts - Screen for PPD/PPA

Question: How to treat postpartum joint pain?
Answer: Joint pain from relaxin hormones and blood deficiency. Points: GB34 (Yanglingquan) for joints - primary. LR3 for Liver blood nourishing joints. SP6 and ST36 for blood. BL17 for blood production. Local Ahshi points. KI3 if Kidney weakness. BL23 for lower back and Kidney. Usually improves as hormones normalize. May take 6+ months.
Points: GB34, LR3, SP6, ST36, BL17, KI3, BL23
Pharmacopeia: Du Huo Ji Sheng Tang; Si Wu Tang
Safety_Warning: Hormonal - Usually improves over months - Build blood

Question: How to treat postpartum fatigue and exhaustion?
Answer: Severe fatigue from blood loss sleep deprivation and Qi depletion. Points: ST36 (Zusanli) is essential - tonifies Qi strongly. CV6 (Qihai) for Qi. SP6 for blood. BL20 BL23 for Spleen and Kidney. GV4 if Yang depleted. GV20 lifts energy. Prioritize rest. Accept help. Nourishing foods. Check thyroid and iron levels if severe.
Points: ST36, CV6, SP6, BL20, BL23, GV4, GV20
Pharmacopeia: Ba Zhen Tang (Eight Treasure); Bu Zhong Yi Qi Tang
Safety_Warning: Essential recovery - Rest priority - Check thyroid/iron if severe

Question: How long should postpartum recovery treatment continue?
Answer: Traditional Chinese postpartum period is 30-40 days (Zuo Yue Zi). Minimum treatment: Weekly for first 4-6 weeks. Optimal: 2x weekly first 2 weeks then weekly for 4 weeks then as needed. Continue until: Energy restored bleeding stopped breastfeeding established mood stable. Full recovery may take 6-12 months depending on birth trauma blood loss baseline health.
Points: Based on symptoms
Pharmacopeia: Varies by pattern
Safety_Warning: Traditional 30-40 day recovery period - Full recovery 6-12 months
